title: Luke Skywalker & Virtue Ethics  | Why Luke is morally superior to the Jedi & Sith
description:
Let's use Star Wars to learn a bit about ethics. In this video, we'll compare the virtue ethics of Luke Skywalker to the deontological ethics of the Jedi (Clone Wars era) and the consequentialist ethics of the Sith to understand why we find Luke compelling as a moral exemplar and hero.

_________________
Members of the Deep Talks Patreon Community receive bonus Q & A Episodes, articles, charts, forum discussions, and access to regular Group Discussions on Zoom. Help us reach our first goal of 300 patrons in order to sustain weekly, ad-free theological and philosophical education to anyone with an internet connection! https://www.patreon.com/deeptalkstheologypodcast

transcript_parts.text: Luke represents the best of virtue
ethics while the Jedi before Luke
represented in many ways the best and

rules or principles that's the

virtue ethics would also be opposed to

focuses on the results of an action as
the standard for measuring whether an
action is right or wrong
it's not that there's an obvious correct
or incorrect choice to each of these

failed your highness
